A finitely supported function can be built in ascending or descending order of "degree".

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message

bors d+

:v: vihdzp can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11213356146/job/31166235901)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11213356146/job/31166236633)

Looks fine by me

maintainer merge

Looks fine by me

maintainer merge
Can you add docstrings to the new induction principles?
Would it make sense to have a version for partial orders with `âˆ€ c âˆˆ f.support, c < a` replaced by `âˆ€ c âˆˆ f.support, Â¬ a â‰¤ c`? I think that could also be useful.

Another thing is that it would be nice to eliminate to `Sort*`
But maybe both of these fall outside the scope of this PR?

This proof relies mostly on `Finset.induction_on_max`, so these changes would have to be implemented there first.

Note that we need a linear order for the `Sort*` version to be useful, as otherwise whichever of two incomparable elements we build first would be entirely arbitrary.
Ok fair. Let's keep it like this.

Is the only difference the order of argument of `+`? Can you mention that in the doc-string? 
I don't like the subscript `â‚‚` to distinguish this version. Maybe `_right` instead of `2`?
Isn't the proof just 1 line from `induction_on_max`? (Though if this is generalized to `Sort* then the definition might matter.)

This naming scheme matches that of [`Finsupp.inductionâ‚‚`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Data/Finsupp/Defs.html#Finsupp.induction%E2%82%82).

I'm not sure how to prove this more effectively, as we're not assuming commutativity in the codomain. (In theory it might be possible to use `AddOpposite`, but I've had trouble using this API in the past due to the irreducibility of the definition).

Oh, you're right, my plan doesn't work without commutativity. I guess you can try to apply it in `AddOpposite M`, but the current situation is fine as well. Can you please mention the difference in the docstring?

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Data/Finsupp/Defs): `induction_on_max`
